FAQ.question: What is an FMB Sketch (Agriculture)?
FAQ.answer: An FMB (Field Measurement Book) Sketch is an official cadastral map that shows the exact boundaries, measurements, and subdivision layout of agricultural land.

FAQ.question: Why is the FMB Sketch important?
FAQ.answer: It is required for land surveys, boundary confirmation, fencing, dispute resolution, property partition, and for verifying the exact physical extent of the land.

FAQ.question: What details are needed to obtain the FMB Sketch?
FAQ.answer: You need the district, taluk, village, survey number, sub-division number (if applicable), and landowner details.

FAQ.question: How long does it take to get the FMB Sketch?
FAQ.answer: If digital records are available, it can be downloaded instantly; otherwise, it may take 1–2 working days depending on the survey department’s data.

FAQ.question: What information does the FMB Sketch contain?
FAQ.answer: It includes survey boundaries, measurements, subdivision layout, adjoining land details, boundary lines, angles, and mapping references used by surveyors.
